headline: An awesome company to work for
pros:
One of the better companies to work for if you want learning and career growth

Some of the smartest people to work with in tech

You can actually implement your ideas here and Engineer managers encourage that

Super chilled out work-environment.

You will have a very good work life balance here

Variable pays are usually paid out for the most part
cons:
The only con I can think of is the low compensation. There are companies out there that are not as popular as redBus and they still pay a lot more than what redBus India pays.

Another con could be that you might be working on some really old codebase and migration to newer stack can take a lot of time and convincing

headline: Horrible work place
pros: Good for freshers as they don't have any knowledge of corporate politics
cons:
There are many cons in redbus as workplace
(1) un realistic deadlines
(2) bad leadership both team leads and managers
(3) cheap politics 
(4) no recognition for hardwork
(5) no proper KT
(6) Appraisal are not very transparent ,rating depends on regionalism and favortism factors.
(7) no work life balance 
(8) no proper planning of things 
(9)ajile methodology is followed for name sake only 
(10) very cheap code quality , no code standards nor testing procedure
Many more

You can learn what not to do, by observing mistakes of senior management staff (this will be helpful for your future) You can learn about the stark contrast between domestic and international companies. Once you have gained knowledge, you can move on (say in 1 year)

headline: Product
pros:
The organization has good hold on the bus system, with many agents, operators, partners.

The company has been established overseas.

Employees treat each other with dignity.
cons:
Resolution for queries and complaints received from the customer and agents will be delayed, due to the chain escalation process.

The system is in such a way that the employees will be more comfortable and will become stagnant.

Policies are made but not followed strictly. Complaints and suggestions are not taken in a systematic way, (they will fulfill the request) back talk about it.

headline: Growing company with a startup at heart work culture
pros:
* Fast paced work environment in any team.
* Passionate people to work with no boundaries of incorporating new technologies to make the system flawless for the end user.
* People are never hesitant to design, code and test any module from scratch, conditions that it should make the user experience a breeze to operate.
* Its never too struggling to reach out to people of any designation including the CTO or CEO themselves, as they respond.

Last but not the least.
* The work culture is pretty transparent.

headline: Not a  Technical review
pros:
Best part of redBus is their Work culture. It is very professional. There is no micro-management of your work.
Meeting and talking to people in higher hierarchy and sharing your ideas is very easy. Valid suggestions are taken up and gets implemented.
If you are an introvert, redBus is the ideal place where you turn up, finish your work and leave whenever you wish to.
We are always pushed to learn and enrich our knowledge even if it is not our domain. We have full time access to udemy, other e-learning sites.
 They treat employee well being with at most respect. I personally benefited when the management went out of its way to help me during tough times.
cons: It is located at the center of Bangalore, Leela Palace. Bachelors would find it difficult to get a Budget-room. Other than that there is nothing.

headline: Pillars of Growth
pros: That's the most important thing that people should look for, a place to grow. redBus personifies that statement. A great place to learn new processes, engage in rewarding discussions, and it's located in Leela Palace. Pays well, rewards hard work, and a majority of the people in the office are really friendly, making it an ideal work environment. redBus is definitely a place to build your career.
cons: There isn't anything negative to say about the work environment here. There are few negative personalities on the floor, a common component in today's world. Even Willy Wonka's Chocolate Factory had these elements in office.

Revenue and profit numbers are  speeding , better stability .

2. QA workload is too high  to do any automation .

3> Too much politics in the team and no room for QA motivation/innovation .

4> Toxic environment is created and maintained , no visibility to the upper management .

5. F&B abuse is pretty regular in the internal meetings , little adherence to the workplace decorum .

headline: Cheap company and cheap policies
pros: College Environment (not everyone likes though)
cons:
Technical Aspects:
1. Very bad code
2. Same repetitive work
3. very little innovation
4.  Unnecessary meetings with no outcomes
5. Many non-technical managers and product managers don't know anything technical.

Cheap HR Policies
1. Snacks are distributed at 6:30 PM so that employees stay at the office till then
2. Recently started morning breakfast too. 
3. Probably first small sized company which has time swipe in/swipe out time tracking. Even big MNCs don't have this kind of rules implemented.
4. Bad pay
If you actually have good work and pay and good managers, you do not need to come up with such cheap techniques.

Unnecessary hirings.  Not sure how these kinds of decisions are implemented and based on whose approval. If CTO and CEO approve these, they seriously need to look into the work culture of other companies. 

Redbus is all you will see in the service company with extra added cheapness.

headline: Open Stack - Open Culture
pros: Flat structure, caring, innovative, CXOs are reachable, flexible timing,  recruits young talent, appreciates self-initiative, explores latest technologies, focus on extra curricular activities and best is very transparent and friendly for any employee
cons: For my 5 years exp in redBus i hardly need to raise any concern. Its difficult to find any cons as you can speak about it openly to Senior Mgmt.

headline: Good startup
pros:
Flexible timing.
Good place to learn for freshers 
CEO and CTO are good peoples .
Office location is comfortable to reach from various part of Bangalore.
cons:
Not good place for experienced peoples .you need to bare with micro managment of some managers who are naive as manager.
No proper team or organization structure.
Product owners are mostly freshers and they behave unprofessional sometimes. No clear requirement for development  and hardly we get properly designed requirements.They just bothered the kra and trying to push product without giving proper time to QA .
Peoples plays blame game for issues leaked to production rather than working as a team to push the fix .
Limited growth option .Redbus is still has work culture as that of a startup .So there is limited opportunities of growth.
HR are non effective. Before joining ask everything to be mentioned over mail or documents.

headline: Software Engineer
pros: You get ownership of your work. You get to build a product end-to-end.
cons:
No proper code review in place. Most of the systems on the floor are built upon a really badly written code base.
Very bad compensation as compared to the market.
Very high attrition rate.
They don't even try to retain good developers.
Most of TLs have very poor technical skills.
No benefits like cab service or free food.

headline: My take on redbus
pros:
Liberty to experiment.

Flexible timings 
- None will bother you until you fail to deliver. Come anytime, go anytime and be in-sync with your manager , NO QUESTIONS asked.

Good, appreciative people and CTO & CEO are cool guys.

Many languages, Many tools - Polyglot development.
 - many argue about polyglot, but this is great as this expands your horizon of tech and solution.

Spot awards and recognition's.

Regular Doctor visit happens every week.

Play Area and lounge -Pool table, Table tennis,Carom,Chess,Foosball.You have so many things if you want relax and chill.

Hot drinks - Coffee,Tea and Milk are available piping hot anytime.
cons:
High attrition rate. They don't retain good talents.

Code quality is pathetic. Since its very agile, coding standards and methodologies are not taken as much in to consideration in most of the teams excluding few.

Few systems are just made so crappy that few aspects of data and insights get lost. I strongly believe this is because of the hard push by managers to the team inorder to accomplish their targets for the timeline given to them.

Nothing major has happened like a game changer ever since the launch.
They incorporate cutting edge tech and have good engineers under the hood, but lack to innovate in bus industry space. Don't get me wrong, they are market leaders in bus industry space. IMO i feel nothing impressive has happened from a customer standpoint of view.

Few teams, lack good technical leaders who fail to impart knowledge and inspire them.

No free food and cab.

Pay and hikes are less and not rewarding.

- More than anything you work for a company that you will be proud to be part of and at the end of the day satisfied.
cons: - Every organization has their flaws, but the knowledge of it makes the difference.

headline: Great place to learn.
pros:
No restriction in technology you want to use. Lots of new things still going on in b2b side. So ample learning opportunity. 
Work culture and people are very good and friendly. Still there is touch of startup culture which is great. Loved every single bit here. 
Great director in b2b. Gives freedom in work.
cons:
Bad recreation- only TT
No cabs
Slightly less pay as compared to other e commerce, but can negotiate and get good pay if you are really good.
Bad canteen.

headline: Great place to learn
pros:
1. Flexibility with technology .
2. Learning opportunities and always on updated technologies.
3. Comfortable work culture, new people can easily get adjusted with team.
cons: Compensation and benefits are less.

headline: Good
pros: You get to work in an environment which has the benefits of both a startup and established company.
cons: Not much of a downside really. Salary is considered slightly on the lower side for an e-commerce company.

headline: The best place to enjoy WORK
pros:
I joined redBus after 9 years of experience where I worked with few MNC's. I am working with redBus for more than 6 years and my experience with redBus is amazing. I feel this is the great place to enjoy your work. Culture is very friendly which gives you flexibility and freedom to explore your thoughts. Great policies and facilities to work within location or even on travel. 

Senior management is reachable and always there to guide & support you. As an employer redBus always take care of employees. 

The best part is the innovations, as a industry leader redBus has innovated lots of products / features which was revolutionary changes for Indian Bus Industry. 

If you are looking for Great Brand, Great Remuneration, Great Facilities & Policies and Best Colleagues to work with then redBus is the right stop for you.
cons: Nothing to mention as cons.....did not found in last 6 years

headline: Coolest place to work
pros: this is the most cool place i have ever worked with. the work environment is awesome and caring. work seems to be very easy as we get lots of support every time. managers are understanding and approachable. they dont just focus on benefit but also give importance to our future and career and develop us accordingly. we work hard but also get appreciated for that. I have made so many new friends and have also got my friends to work here. if you are looking for place to work and have fun at same time; and get paid for your hard work, this is place you should think about.
cons: cant think of anything particular as of now

headline: recommended to everyone
pros: this is great organisation to work, and i have invited most of my friends to work here. We have lot of fun. managers are very helpful, supportive and motivating. They always stay in touch and helps us to plan career. Management team is amazing and very inspiring. we get plenty of opportunities to express skills and talent.
cons: as of now nothing

headline: Amazing Place to Work!!!!!
pros: I found work environment is very positive. Management is always approachable. We always get rewarded for our achievements instead of pressure, seniors direct & instruct us how to improve & do our job more effectively and efficiently.
cons: As of now I didn't find anything.

headline: Great place to enjoy your work
pros: I am working with redBus for more than 4 years and I have enjoyed every bit of it. Management team is very efficient and take care of every small need. they will ensure that you will grow and develop yourself. work place is fun and enjoyable and every time we will celebrate all kind of events. I recommend all my friends to work here and make better career choice.

headline: Great Organization with some serious
pros: helps to flourish creativity, promotes autonomy, offers freedom, knows meaning of service industry & actually wants to bring change and help people instead of just earning or conning, best option if you believe in work with contribution and fulfillment; they have a very strong bonding within, salary structure is nice.
cons: Before getting all excited about all freedom, fulfillment and service stuff; make sure that your manager is more capable and more skillful than you. If not; lie low; don‚Äôt show off skills; don‚Äôt expect to be appreciated or recognized; never do something beyond KRAs & expect to be recognized for that. (If you are located in Bangalore and working in Head office then you have no reason to worry). if you end up using your skills by mistake; make sure that you let your manager take all credit. dont be different or daring. most important; don‚Äôt ever try to improve anything around; get used to it till you are reporting to right person. there are lots of opportunities to work on amenities and workplace.

headline: Content/Creative Writer (Brand Marketing)
pros:
There always is someone who will listen to your ideas. No dearth of innovation and the people around are pretty amazing. 
I found that the growth opportunities are great if you are good at what you do. You role is not limited to only what you have to do, instead, you can actually do what you WANT to do. It is flexible that way. I find it quite exciting! 
Also, redBus is expanding and I think working here will give you a good exposure and knowledge about how other markets work.
cons: The appraisal could be a little better.

headline: Product Manager
pros: Great place to learn and experiment with developing new products. There is a lot of autonomy even for junior or mid-level employees.
cons:
Employees are treated like products company can use and throw. Hard working employees have no value, but you will find many employees with no contribution ambling around in fancy dresses. Senior management is only busy chasing numbers. No functional HR department. No HR head. No HR policies. 

If you want to repent spending time in a company and learn how your work is thoroughly ignored, redbus is the place to join.
